title: NETWORK_POLICIES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This Account Usage view returns one row for each network policy in your account.
Internal system-generated identifier for network policy.
Name of role that owns the network policy.

The type of role that owns the object, for example ROLE. . If a Snowflake Native App owns the object, the value is APPLICATION. . Snowflake returns NULL if you delete the object because a deleted object does not have an owner role.
Comment for the network policy (if any).
Date and time that the network policy was created.
Date and time that the network policy was last altered.
Date and time the network policy was dropped.
List of allowed IPv4 addresses and CIDR block ranges in the corresponding network policy.
List of blocked IPv4 addresses and CIDR block ranges in the corresponding network policy.
Latency for the view may be up to 120 minutes (2 hours).
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.
